title: Strawberry Lassi

preparations.content: Place strawberries, sugar and ground cardamom in mixing bowl then blend <b>30 sec/speed 7<b>.
Add yoghurt and ice then mix <b>1 min/speed 5<b>. Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

hintsAndTricks: Fresh mint can be substituted for ground cardamom.
Frozen strawberries can also be used. Omit ice cubes and add water until desired consistency is achieved.

To grind your own cardamom, place a minimum of 2 Tbsp pods in mixing bowl and mix<b> <b>5 sec<b>//<b>speed 4-6<b> then discard the husks. Grind the seeds at <b>speed 10<b> until fine. Transfer to a sterilised jar and use when needed.

Lassi is a yoghurt-based drink that can be sweet or savoury and modern versions (widely available in restaurants) use fruit as a sweetener. We’ve teamed it here with a very British fruit. If you’re making this in the summer when strawberries are in season and that bit sweeter, you may like to reduce the sugar or omit it completely.
